name: Subscriber Triggered Mobility
summary: The Subscriber Triggered Mobility feature enables individual control of mobility

parameters.name: RATFreqPrio.bandClassPrioListCDMA1xRtt
parameters.description: See MOM description.  The attribute references struct BandClassPrioCdma1xRtt. The struct has                                 the following members:    cdma1xRttBandClass     cellReselectionPriority     csFallbackPrio     csFallbackPrioEC     freqCdma     voicePrio

parameters.name: RATFreqPrio.bandClassPrioListCDMA2000
parameters.description: See MOM description.  The attribute references struct BandClassPrioCDMA2000. The struct has                                 the following members:    cellReselectionPriority     connectedModeMobilityPrio     freqCdma     hrpdBandClass

parameters.name: RATFreqPrio.freqGroupPrioListGERAN
parameters.description: See MOM description.  The attribute references struct FreqGroupPrioGERAN. The struct has the                                 following members:    cellReselectionPriority     connectedModeMobilityPrio     frequencyGroupId     bandIndicatorGERAN     csFallbackPrio     csFallbackPrioEC     voicePrio

parameters.name: RATFreqPrio.freqPrioListEUTRA
parameters.description: See MOM description.  The attribute references struct FreqPrioEUTRA. The struct has the                                 following members:    cellReselectionPriority     connectedModeMobilityPrio     arfcnValueEUtranDl     loadBalancingAllowed     offloadAllowed     voicePrio

parameters.name: RATFreqPrio.freqPrioListUTRA
parameters.description: See MOM description.  The attribute references struct FreqPrioUTRAN. The struct has the                                 following members:    cellReselectionPriority     connectedModeMobilityPrio     arfcnValueUtranDl     loadBalancingAllowed     csFallbackPrio     csFallbackPrioEC     voicePrio

parameters.name: PtmFunction.ptmEnabled
parameters.description: These parameters are used to enable and configure the Preferential                                 Traffic Management solution. With appropriate configuration, the                                 following applies:  Idle mode prioritization can be inhibited between some             cells—to priority cells with very high traffic load from non-priority cells. This             ensures that priority cells are not overloaded, so priority UEs have access in very high             load traffic situations.  For more information, see Preferential Traffic Management                                     Guidelines.

parameters.name: RATFreqPrio.nrMobilityTrigQciAllAllowed
parameters.description: When the Subscriber Triggered Mobility feature is active and the UE                                 is assigned an SPID value, the UE can only be moved to NR standalone                                 if the specific service is activated. This requires setting one of                                 the following attributes to false in the                                 corresponding MO instance:  RATFreqPrio.nrMobilityTrigQciAllAllowed     UeProfileFilter.nrMobilityTrigQciAllAllowed

parameters.name: UeMeasControl.nrB1MeasWindow
parameters.description: If the UE has an SPID value associated with it, the                                     UeMeasControl.nrB1MeasWindow timer is started                                 based on the priorities defined in                                 the FreqPrioNR MO class.

parameters.name: UeProfileFilter.nrMobilityTrigQciAllAllowed
parameters.description: When the Subscriber Triggered Mobility feature is active and the UE                                 is assigned an SPID value, the UE can only be moved to NR standalone                                 if the specific service is activated. This requires setting one of                                 the following attributes to false in the                                 corresponding MO instance:  RATFreqPrio.nrMobilityTrigQciAllAllowed     UeProfileFilter.nrMobilityTrigQciAllAllowed

events.name: INTERNAL_EVENT_PTM_CELL_RESERVED_START
events.type: Triggered when the load is above threshold or the S1-C                                         connection to the priority PLMN is recovered. It indicates                                         that the cell is reserved for operator use.

events.name: INTERNAL_EVENT_PTM_CELL_RESERVED_STOP
events.type: Triggered when the load is below threshold or the S1-C                                         connection to the priority PLMN failed. It indicates that                                         the cell is no longer reserved for operator use.

events.name: INTERNAL_EVENT_PTM_CELL_RESERVED_SUSP_START
events.type: Triggered when the load is above threshold or the S1-C                                         connection to the priority PLMN failed. It indicates that                                         the cell reservation for operator use is suspended.

events.name: INTERNAL_EVENT_PTM_CELL_RESERVED_SUSP_STOP
events.type: Triggered when the load is below threshold or the S1-C                                         connection to the priority PLMN is recovered. It indicates                                         that the suspension of cell reservation for operator use is                                         over.

activation_step: 1. Set the FeatureState.featureState attribute to ACTIVATED in the FeatureState=CXC4011063 MO instance.
deactivation_step: 1. Set the FeatureState.featureState attribute to DEACTIVATED in the FeatureState=CXC4011063 MO instance.
